#Text=Gloucester ( New South Wales )
#Text=Gloucester
#Text=is a small country town nestled in the Avon Valley , in the Manning District of the Mid-North Coast , New South Wales , Australia .
#Text=Home to around 4000 people , the area is a scenic one , a short drive from the Hunter Valley .
#Text=Its industries include dairy and beef cattle , tourism and , to a lesser extent , timber milling .

#Text=Gloucester 's main attractions are its beautiful green landscapes ( Gloucester has one of the highest rainfalls in New south Wales ) , its scenic fresh water rivers , its festivals and annual show , the Barrington Tops National Park and the iconic Bucketts ( a unique mountain formation ) , at the base of which the town sits .
#Text=History
#Text=The Gloucester district was first visited by Robert Dawson , Chief Agent for the Australian Agricultural Company - or the A.A. Company as it was generally known - in 1826 .
#Text=Settlement occurred in the 1830s .
#Text=The township of Gloucester was first established in 1855 , primarily for sheep farming , however it became apparent that the land was not entirely suitable .
#Text=The four main industries of the Gloucester area are : tourism , timber , cattle farming and , now , coal .
#Text=The timber industry has been prevalent in Gloucester since the late 19th century , and it and cattle farming are still major industries in and around Gloucester ; both dairy and beef cattle .

#Text=For most of the twentieth century it boasted two cinemas in the main thoroughfare - Church Street : The Star ( opposite Permewans , closed c1968 ) , and the Majestic Theatre ( built early 1920s ) .
#Text=The Majestic did not permanently close its doors until c1980 , and although the building still stands it is now a shopping arcade .
#Text=The district has a weekly newspaper , The Gloucester Advocate .

#Text=In March 1972 His Excellency the Governor of New South Wales , Sir Roden Cutler , VC , etc. , and Lady Cutler toured the district and attended a formal Civic Reception at the Gloucester Bucketts Motel .
#Text=In 1876 , gold was discovered in Copeland , a small town north-west of Gloucester .
#Text=Copeland became a large town of over 3,000 inhabitants due to the gold discovery and the large number of red cedar ( Toona australis ) trees .
#Text=However , the population has since dwindled to a population of a few hundred .

#Text=The Australian Agricultural Company had been awarded mineral rights to half a million acres ( 2,000 km ² ) between the Karuah River and the Manning River , which covered the Gloucester district .

#Text=The company employed surveyors in 1856-7 to undertake a trial survey for a railway between Port Stephens and Stroud , New South Wales and north passing what became Gloucester to the Manning River .

#Text=At the time it was felt that with the " formidable obstructions " from ranges and rivers a line would be impracticable and construction was not proceeded with , and coal mining was abandoned before it had commenced .
#Text=However , in 1995 , Gloucester Coal , originally Stratford Coal , began mining in Stratford , a small town 12 km south of Gloucester , this is the only active coal mine in the region .
#Text=Over the past few years Gloucester Resources has bought land closer to the township for the purpose of mining .
#Text=Although the majority of the local community oppose the operation , it is possible that in the next few years mining in the area will commence and taint this beautiful valley permanently .
#Text=The township and surrounding area
#Text=The Township of Gloucester is a small one containing a main street lined with small cafes , clothing shops , real estate agents , two grocery stores , two pubs and a bakery .
#Text=There are no traffic lights in Gloucester however there are two round-a-bouts .
#Text=If you 're out to seek the Australian country town experience , Gloucester is a perfect destination .

#Text=There are a number of small townships in the surrounding area , the biggest being Barrington , which has a General store , a Salon , a hall and a few houses , there is also Stratford , Craven and Rookhurst .
#Text=There are also rural areas known as parishes which encompass Gloucester , such as Mograni , Avon , Forbesdale , Faulkland and Belbora .
#Text=Tourist information centre
#Text=The Gloucester Visitor
#Text=Information Centre is at 27 Denison St , just around the corner from the Foodworks supermarket on the main street .
#Text=By train
#Text=can be reached by NSW Trainlink Regional trains that travel up and down the north coast line to and from Sydney to Grafton or Brisbane .
#Text=Several trains make the journey both ways everyday .
#Text=Trip from Sydney takes around 4 hours and 15 minutes .
#Text=Prices are usually around $ 30 but do vary depending on the season .
#Text=By bus
#Text=NSW Trainlink Regional
#Text=buses are the only other option of public transport , they are cheaper than the trains but also much slower .
#Text=By car

#Text=Gloucester can be reached also by car , the main road to town has a turnoff onto the Pacific Highway , the turnoff for those coming from the south is about 10 km after Heatherbrae and at Nabiac for those coming from the north .
